ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: A systematic understanding of queueing theory and dynamic programming
The knowledge about queue system and dynamic programming.
Basic operations queueing model and dynamic programming, and their applications.

A good introduction to Queueing Theory and Dynamic Programming. For the first part, we understood the methodology that is used and we can now use it in our research. Fro the second part, that was more complicated, what matters after all is that we know that some things can be done using dynamic programming and we also know where to look for the methodology. In general, the course offered useful research tools.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The final paper presentation is a very good idea, that exposes us to applications of the theory in different fields. In my opinion, in the midterm we needed some more time. The difficulty was moderate. Some of the queueing theory assignments were just applications of theory that we would not cover. (It's a way of creating exercises, but not the best). I would also like to receive real feedback from the grader of the assignments. It is positive that the TA uploaded solutions, but I would like more feedback on my solutions.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: It provides with theories and techniques which are common in some research fields. I will recommend it to another student if his/her research is related.
Yes. but this course is very focused on dynamic programming, I would only recommend to student who want to learn this specific topic.
Yes, if you are very interested in queueing models or DP, this is the very best course to take.
Yes, because it is a very good introduction in Operations Research. Following the book guided by the Professor helps build strong foundations.
